turns.text: Task 1: Reporting an Internet Outage at Your Housing

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Hi How are u?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Hey! I’m good, thanks for asking. How about you — how’s your day going so far?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: I'm good. Thanks

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Glad to hear that! What are you up to today?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Today you will be a call center operator for the internet company. I'm calling you because I'm having internet problems. So, you can start my call.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Sure! [phone line clicks] Hello, this is Alex from SkyNet Internet Support. Thanks for calling today. Can you please tell me what kind of problem you’re having with your internet?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Transcrição indisponível

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Absolutely. So let

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Hi, Alex.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Hi there! All right, let’s get started. Can you tell me a bit more about what exactly is going on with your connection right now?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Oh, my internet doesn't work.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Got it. So your internet’s not working at all. Let’s start with this: are you seeing any error messages on your devices or is it just not connecting?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Not connecting, since 1 o'clock p.m., 1 p.m.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: All right, so it

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “and in the morning it's okay, but now it doesn't work.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: I see. So it was working fine this morning, and now it’s just stopped. Let me ask: have you tried restarting your router since it went out?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Yes, I tried.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: All right, good to know you’ve already tried that. In that case, let's check one more thing: do you have any lights on your router that are blinking or off that normally should be on?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Could you repeat?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Sure! So I was just asking if you could take a look at your router and see if any of the lights are blinking or off when they should normally be on. What do you see there?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Hi, it's normal.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: All right, if the lights are normal, that’s helpful to know. Now, just to narrow it down a bit more, are you using Wi-Fi or a wired connection when you’re trying to get online?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “In the moment, I'm trying to use Wi-Fi, but our lights are not open.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Gotcha. You're on Wi-Fi and not all the lights are on. That definitely gives us a clue. Now, have you noticed if any other devices in your home are having the same issue, or is it just this one device you're trying?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Sorry, I can't understand. Could you repeat, please?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Of course! So I was just asking if it's only one device having the problem or if all your devices can't connect. How is it for your other devices?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Could you repeat, please?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Sure thing! So basically, I'm just asking: are all of your devices having the same internet issue, or is it just this one you're using right now?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “I'll adjust it when I use it right now.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: All right, so it's just that one device acting up. That’s helpful to know. Let me ask you one more thing: have you tried forgetting the Wi-Fi network on that device and reconnecting it?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Yes, I've tried but it doesn't work. I removed the socket on the wall and I put it again, but the wireless started, but it doesn't work. It doesn't have a signal, not for me and my other flatmates.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: All right, I get you. So you did try unplugging and plugging it back in, and it's still not giving a signal for you or your flatmates. Let me ask this next: have you contacted your internet service provider before about outages in your area, or is this the first time you're reaching out?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “It's my first time.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: All right, thanks for letting me know it's your first time reaching out. Let's do this: I'll go ahead and check if there's any known outage in your area on our end. Could you just tell me your address or the area you're located in?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Of course, my address is Pitt Street.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Perfect, thanks for that. Let me just take a quick look and see if there's any reported issue in that area. In the meantime, is there anything else about the situation you'd like me to know?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Is there a technical available today?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Absolutely, I can check that for you. Let me see if we have a technician available today who can come out and help. Meanwhile, is there a time today that would work best for you if we do need to send someone over?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Could you check if there is an outage in the area?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Sure, I can definitely do that. Let me quickly check if there's an outage reported in your area. Just give me a moment. In the meantime, if there's anything else that comes to mind about the problem, feel free to let me know.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “What should I try before you send someone?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Yeah, of course! One last thing you might try is just restarting the device itself, like your computer or phone, and then reconnecting. But if that doesn't help, I'll definitely line up a technician for you. So let me know if that restart helps at all.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Okay, but should I wait here, or will someone call me?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Sure, you can just hang tight here for a moment, and I'll let you know what I find. So no worries, I'll give you the update right here. And if we do need to send someone, I'll let you know how that’ll work. Sound good?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Good.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Great! All right, I’ll just check that outage info and we’ll figure things out from there. So just sit tight, and I’ll let you know in a sec if we need to send someone or if there’s an update.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Okay.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: All right, perfect! So I’m checking that for you now. Just give me a moment and I’ll let you know what I find. In the meantime, just relax and I’ll keep you posted in just a sec.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Yes, okay, I will to wait you.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: All right, thanks for your patience! I’ll let you know as soon as I’ve got that info. So just hang tight for a moment and I’ll get right back to you.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “OK.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Great! So I’ve checked and it looks like there actually is a small outage in your area, which might explain the problem. We’re already working on it, and it should be fixed in a few hours. If you still have issues after that, just let us know and we can send someone out. Anything else I can help with?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Who can I contact if this isn't resolved today?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Sure! If it’s not resolved today, you can just contact us again at this same support line and we’ll be happy to help. We’re here 24/7, so just reach out if you need anything else.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Okay, thank you.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: You're very welcome! If you need anything else, just let me know. Otherwise, I hope your internet is back up and running soon. Thanks for calling and have a great day!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “I hope you have a great day, too.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Thank you so much! I appreciate that. All right, well, if there's nothing else, feel free to reach out anytime. Have a lovely day!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “You, too.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Thanks a lot! Take care and I’ll be here if you need anything else. Have a good one!
